main event: A civilian observed a single, fast-moving, brilliant red object with an orange glow from the rear, similar in shape to a T-33 aircraft, in the sky over Pontiac, Michigan on January 29, 1960.
interesting points: The object moved at a high speed and crossed the sky from east to west in 3 to 6 seconds.
The object's brightness and speed initially attracted the observer's attention.
The object was reported as being north of Pontiac, Michigan and heading southeast.
There were no known aircraft in the area at the time of the sighting.
The weather conditions included a 3,530 foot ceiling, 7 mile visibility, and scattered cloud cover, with no thunderstorms.
sighted object: a single, fast-moving, brilliant red object with an orange glow from the rear, similar in shape to a T-33 aircraft
